p.em: Once the Shield of Ironspire, Now a Warrior without a Banner...

description.p: The Exiled Crest were once the elite warriors of Ironspire, sworn protectors of the city's rulers and enforcers of its will. Betrayed, cast out, or forsaken, these warriors now walk their own path, honing their skills beyond the rigid traditions they once upheld. No longer bound by duty, they have become weapons of their own making- unpredictable, adaptable, and unrelenting.

sheet.description: The archetypal Exiled Crest focuses on several different stances to gain the advantage on the battlefield.

description.p: The fall from grace has only hardened your resolve. You have learned to fight without the support of a legion, adapting to any battlefield. Choose one of the following battlestances at the start of your turn (no action required):
Sentinel's Aegis: When a creature within 5 feet of you attacks an ally, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack. You also gain a +1 bonus to AC.
Vengeful Strike: The first time you take damage each round, you gain advantage on your next weapon attack and deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Ghost Step: Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action. Opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.
You can switch between these stances at the start of your turn.

Ghost Step: Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action. Opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage. description.p: Your experience as a former Crestwatch grants you an unrivaled sense of battlefield control, at 7th level, when you roll initiative, you can immediately switch to a different stance without using an action. After hitting a creature with a melee attack, you can move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative, you can switch to a different stance before combat begins. After hitting a creature with a melee attack, you can move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: You refuse to kneel, no matter how dire the situation. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10 + half the damage taken). On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this feature once per long rest. Additionally, you gain proficiency in Strength saving throws if you don't already have it.

sheet.description: Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10 + half the damage taken). On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

description.p: Survival has made you an expert in shifting your tactics. When you take damage from an attack or fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to immediately change your battle stance. Additionally, when you use your Second Wind feature, you can switch to a different stance without using an action.

sheet.description: When you take damage from an attack or fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to immediately change your battle stance. Additionally, when you use your Second Wind feature, you can switch to a different stance without using an action.

description.p: You have surpassed your former brethren, becoming a warrior feared across the land. Choose two stances instead of one, benefiting from both simultaneously. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can force them to make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength or Dexterity modifier). On a failure, they are either knocked prone or pushed 10 feet away (your choice).

p.em: Scars of Orithar, Strength of the Forsaken

description.p: The wilds of Orithar are dangerous, full of war-torn ruins, towering peaks, and restless gods. Those who walk the Path of the Ravager draw upon the ancient echoes of fallen titans, primeval spirits, and the raw fury of the land itself. These barbarians are not merely warriors- they are living embodiments of destruction and survival, wielding the chaotic power of Orithar's forsaken past.

sheet.description: The Path of the Ravaged Titan is the living remnant of Orithar's ancient power

description.p: When you rage, you channel the power of Orithar's lost titans. Your body surges with supernatural strength, and your attacks carry the force of a forgotten age. While raging, you gain the following benefits:
Once per turn, your melee weapon attack deals an additional 1d6 force damage.
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can push it 5 feet away from you.
Your Strength checks and saving throws cannot be made at disadvantage.

sheet.description: While raging, you gain the following benefits: Once per turn, your melee weapon attack deals an additional 1d6 force damage. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you may push it 5 feet away from you. Your Strength checks and saving throws cannot be made at disadvantage.

element.name: Endurance of the Forsaken
element.description:
Your body has been shaped by the relentless hardships of Orithar, making you nearly unbreakable. You gain the following benefits:
You have resistance to force damage.
If you are under half your maximum hit points at the start of your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Barbarian level.
When you succeed on a Strength or Constitution saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you can use your reaction to send a shockwave in a 10-foot radius, forcing creatures of your choice to make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength modifier) or be knocked prone. </description

description.p: You have inherited the might of Orithar's fallen colossi, allowing you to overpower any foe.
Your carrying capacity doubles, and you count as one size larger for grappling and lifting purposes.

When you hit a creature at least one size larger than you, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength modifier) or be staggered, giving it disadvantage on attack rolls and bility checks until the end of its next turn.
When you grapple a creature, you can crush them with sheer might, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier at the start of each of their turns.

description.p: You unleash the full, devastating power of Orithar's lost titans, shaking the battlefield with every strike.

While raging, you can use a bonus action to slam the ground, creating a 20-foot shockwave centered on you. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength modifier) or be knocked prone and take 4d6 force damage.
Once per turn, when you take damage from an enemy within 10 feet, you can unleash a retaliatory force wave, dealing force damage equal to your Barbarian level to the attacker.
